name: Hilton Garden Inn Houston / Bush Intercontinental Airport

reviews.text: Hotel in an excellent position for the airport ( a little far out of city centre of that's what you need ) breakfast and meal menu good , friendly staff. Nice clean pool( could be visually blocked from view of car park would be nice) good little gym. Most important good price, I would stay again.
reviews.title: Great hotel, staff good attentive and friendly

reviews.text: After missing a connecting flight back to Raleigh, we ended up finding this hotel at nearly 9pm.
reviews.title: Pretty Good

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Great Nights Stay at Bush Intercontinental

reviews.text: - Good food even though they were about 10 minutes to close. Consistent, good quality, and fair prices
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay.

reviews.text: - Room was clean
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.text: I've been staying now at the Hilton Garden Inn for the past 4 years. I haven't been here for 2 years until today. I was really amazed to find the same pleasant staff like Kiva and Dalsy still on board. It's seldom that you find such a low turnover at hotels these days. And, even better when the good employees stay.
reviews.title: Continuity of staff and Nice jogging/walking loop

reviews.text: Over the years I've been running a nice little 1.5 mile (2.50km) loop just behind the hotel. It's quiet, little traffic, well lit and secure. Turn left onto Kendrick Plaza, left at Diplomatic Plaza, left again at International, then left (back to the hotel) at the frontage road.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, free airport shuttle, very good restaurant

reviews.text: One slight problem in the morning, the breakfast restaurant didn't show my credit card as recorded, which would have meant running back upstairs to the fourth floor for cash or credit card. Just make sure at check-in that your credit cards are registered on the restaurant system for any incidentals. Fortunately, Dalsy and the front desk sorted out the problem. Otherwise, a really nice stay.
reviews.title: Cold food and jewelry stolen!

reviews.text: Stayed here overnight on the way to Galveston for a cruise, hotel is about 60 miles from Galveston cruise terminal, easy access to highway. Staff was pleasant and helpful. I drove to Houston, but was meeting family who had to fly in the drive to Galveston, so this was perfect. Easy access to hotel off the interstate, free parking, and those that flew in took the free shuttle from the airport. We ate dinner and breakfast at the hotel restaurant, everything was fast and friendly, sorry about someone else's lunch, but it could be "seminar" cuisine.
reviews.title: Good for a quick stay...

reviews.text: I would definately stay here again esp for the convienience, price was well within reason.
reviews.title: Bad service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Needed one night near the airport after a long flight from the UK and I got this for $50 plus points via hhonors. You MUST call for the shuttle at the airport - unlike other hotels they do not operate a shuttle on a 30 min loop. I didn't know this and the hotel website does not mention it so after 20 mins I got a taxi to the hotel - an annoying start
reviews.title: Useful for a one night stay

reviews.text: On arrival check in was very friendly - we were offered a drinks voucher for the shuttle inconvenience. I really liked the reception staff as they were empowered and efficient - just what you need when things go wrong.
reviews.title: Decent for an overnight near the Airport

reviews.text: Room was a king bed - standard Hilton Garden Inn room (lots of dark green carpet :)) - clean, well maintained with an exceptionally comfy bed - more like a Sofitel than a Hilton. Top marks for a good nights sleep - hardly any airplane noise too.
reviews.title: Hilton Stay

reviews.text: Breakfast was fine - I had fruit, bagel and coffee & juice but there was cooked to order too. Waitress was lovely - really good at her job,
reviews.title: Nice; good breakfast and friendly efficient staff

reviews.text: Shuttle back to airport leaves every 30 mins (on the hour/half hour) and as it was only us the kindly driver took us direct to the car rental lot which was much appeciated!
reviews.title: Pretty Lousy

reviews.text: I have stayed here before, and had intended to book the same hotel again, but was not paying attention when I booked. I selected the Homewood Suites By Hilton HOU Intercontinental Arpt by mistake. It was not until I was driving up to the hotel I realized “this is not the same hotel I stayed at last time”. The Check In Desk person was very understanding and good to me, and promptly picked up the phone and called the Hilton Garden Inn and explained my error, and asked if they had a room. The answer was yes so I said goodbye to the nice lady at Homewood Suites and with directions from her drove down the road to the Garden Inn.
reviews.title: Great Location & Great Service
Good for layover. Just ok
reviews.text: Upon arrival at this hotel I was promptly checked in. Two days later I realized I needed to stay an extra two days in Houston and asked the Front Desk if I could extend my stay. I was told the hotel was fully booked the next night. I must have looked very distressed or sad because the Reception lady asked “did I really want to stay here”? I said “of course”, she started typing away on the computer and after about two minutes said “Ok” you can stay. I don’t know how she did it, I hope no one else got kicked out of their room…

reviews.title: Perfectly adequate
reviews.text: I will add the disclaimer that I am a Hilton Gold Member, but for real Road Worriers they will know that is an "ok" status, but not at all the top tier for Hilton.
I really love the breakfast here and even if you request made to order omelets, pancakes, etc. the price is a very reasonable $11.00 which is far below most other hotels.
reviews.title: Great hotel near IAH

reviews.text: Nothing bothers me more than having to pay $15 or $20 for breakfast at a hotel, and usually that does not include made to order items.
reviews.title: Always a pleasure to visit this property.

aka: Hilton Garden Inn Houston / Bush Intercontinental Airport Hotel Houston
description: Welcome to the Hilton Garden Inn Houston/Bush Intercontinental Airport hotel, located two miles south of the airport at the World Houston Business Center on John F. Kennedy Blvd. Our welcoming hotel is situated near prominent businesses including; Siemens, GE Oil & Gas, United Airlines, downtown Houston and the George R. Brown Convention Center. The Reliant Center and the Galleria Mall are all within easy reach of the hotel via major highways and tollways.
